Hello

Hello! I'd be happy to help answer your question about how planes fly! 😊

Planes fly by using the principles of aerodynamics, which is the study of how air moves around objects. When a plane moves forward, the air flows over and under its wings, creating an area of lower air pressure above the wings and higher air pressure below them. This pressure difference creates an upward force called lift, which allows the plane to fly.
